tests.sic.rnqt.nbin

Class RnQTCnbinBoxed

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.sic.rnqt.nbin.RnQTCnbin
      • tests.sic.rnqt.nbin.RnQTCnbinBoxed
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf

    public class RnQTCnbinBoxed
extends RnQTCnbin
    the class extends the RnQTCnbin class with the functionality that it projects any argument for evaluation into the feasible region of the class. Essentially it projects the arguments into their box-constrained feasible region, so that the constraints R integer, Q ∈ N={1,2,3...} and T > 0 are always satisfied before attempting a function evaluation. Notice that there are no additional checks on the system parameters (ie on the parameters Kr Ko, L etc.)

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2021

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • RnQTCnbinBoxed

        public RnQTCnbinBoxed(double Kr,
                      double Ko,
                      double L,
                      double lambda,
                      double p_l,
                      double h,
                      double p)
        sole public constructor, simply calls the constructor of the base class.
        Parameters:
        Kr - double the review cost
        Ko - double the ordering cost
        L - double the lead-time
        lambda - double the rate of the demand arrivals in a time unit
        p_l - double the parameter of the logarithmic distribution modeling the quantity of demand asked per demand arrival
        h - double the holding cost per unit of items per unit of time
        p - double the penalty cost of back-orders per unit of items back- logged per unit of time

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object arg,
                   java.util.HashMap params)
        evaluates the (R,nQ,T) policy on the given parameters, projecting first the parameters back into the feasible region if needed. Fractional values for R and Q are rounded into the nearest integer (for Q, into nearest positive integer).
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Overrides:
        eval in class RnQTCnbin
        Parameters:
        arg - Object // double[]{R,Q,T}
        params - HashMap unused
        Returns:
        double
